p: Figure 8 shows the content of sesamin and sesamolin as reported for varieties and accessions from three continents. The source data and references for this overview are provided in Supplementary Information. The overview confirms a positive correlation between the content of sesamin and sesamolin. No relationship between the geographical origin and lignan content is apparent, which was expected because sesame is an old crop with a long history of seeds trade [ 1, 215].
